Incko u SB UN: Koren zastoja u BiH su tri najveće stranke, SNSD, SDA i HDZ

05 Nov 2019, 19:55

Visoki predstavnik za Bosnu i Hercegovinu Valentin Incko izjavio je danas pred Savetom bezbednosti Ujedinjenih nacija da su koren zastoja u BiH tri najveće nacionalne stranke, Savez nezavisnih socijaldemokrata (SNSD), Stranka demokratske akcije (SDA) i Hrvatska demokratska zajednica (HDZ) BiH."U korenu zastoja je, bar na nivou države i Federacije BiH, podela izmedju najvećih nacionalnih stranaka – vladajućih stranaka sa sedištem u Federaciji, SDA i HDZ, i vladajuće stranke sa sedištem u Republici Srpskoj, SNSD", rekao je Incko, podnoseći 56. izveštaj generalnom sekretaru UN o stanju sprovodjenja mira u BiH.Incko je ocenio da su konkurentske vizije te tri stranke za BiH, i njihovo tumačenje Ustava BiH, često protiv uslova koji su deo civilnog aspekta Dejtonskog mirovnog sporazuma.On je naveo da su entitetske vlade usvojile niz reformskih mera programa Evropske unije, ali je dodao da nije postignut nikakav napredak u formiranju nove državne vlasti, posle opštih izbora u oktobru 2018. godine.Visoki predstavnik je kazao da se strane ne slažu u vezi s osnovnim aspektima Ustava BiH, pri čemu, kako je ocenio, neke stranke sa sedištem u Republici Srpskoj osporavaju samu ulogu i ovlašćenja države u njoj, kao i prethodno dogovorene politike i pravne obaveze prema NATO, preneli su sarajevski mediji."U maju je dostavljeno mišljenje Evropske komisije vezano za evropske integracije BiH, u kojem je utvrdjeno 14 ključnih prioriteta koje vlasti BiH moraju da ispune u procesu prema otvaranju pregovora o pristupanju, što je trebalo da motiviše političke vodje da prevazidju razlike i započnu s ključnim reformama", naveo je Incko.Umesto toga, dodao je, lideri SNSD, SDA i HDZ BiH, u avgustu su sklopili sporazum o načelima za formiranje vlasti koji je istekao u septembru, bez rezultata, "što je dovelo do još većih nemira i pretnji, posebno SNSD-a, da će se povući iz postojećih sporazuma".Incko je ukazao da je lider SNSD i srpski član Predsedništva BiH Milorad Dodik zapretio da će povući Republiku Srpsku iz sporazuma o legalnom prenosu nadležnosti s entiteta na državu, koji su dva entiteta potpisala pre uspostavljanja jedinstvenih Oružanih snaga BiH, jedinstvenog Visokog sudskog i tužilačkog saveta (VSTS) i Uprave za indirektno oporezivanje (UIO)."Dodik je upozorio da će biti poništeni svi zakoni i odluke donete 'pod pritiskom visokog predstavnika', čak i oni odobreni u parlamentu Bosne i Hercegovine", kazao je Incko.Visoki predstavnik je naveo da još funkcioniše Savet ministara BiH iz prošlog mandata, ali da je njegov rad "ograničen politički sračunatom i nepotrebnom blokadom parlamenta BiH"."To znači da ne mogu da se usvajaju novi zakoni, uključujući budžet na državnom nivou, što uveliko onemogućava zemlju da se efikasno nosi s aktuelnim problemima kao što je migrantska kriza", ocenio je Incko.On je naveo da je nastavljena i destabilizujuća retorika podela koja dominira političkom situacijom."Neki politički lideri iz RS i dalje daju izjave kojima izražavaju separatističke tendencije ili pak predvidjaju raspad BiH, dok neki hrvatski predstavnici traže teritorijalnu reorganizaciju zemlje. Istovremeno, najveća bošnjačka stranka opet je usvojila stranačku platformu koja zagovara Republiku BiH što nije bilo konstruktivno", rekao je Incko.On je naveo da je i dalje "veoma rašireno veličanje osudjenih ratnih zločinaca koje uveliko otežava mogućnost postizanja istinskog i trajnog pomirenja medju svim narodima".Ukazao je i na problem nedostatka vladavine prava u zemlji i dodao da će vladavina prava i funkcionalnost pravosudnih institucija biti njegovi prioriteti u narednom periodu.Incko je rekao da je "posebno sramotna pojava revizionizma ili čak otvoreno negiranje genocida u Srebrenici, koji je pravna činjenica potvrdjena presudama medjunarodnih i domaćih pravosudnih organa"."U Srebrenici je 1995. godine počinjen genocid. Ništa i niko ne može promeniti tu činjenicu", kazao je Incko.

Incko at UN Security Council: The root of the deadlock in BiH are the three largest parties, the SNSD, the SDA and the HDZ

05 Nov 2019, 18:55

High Representative for Bosnia and Herzegovina Valentin Incko told the United Nations Security Council today that the root of the deadlock in BiH are the three largest national parties, the Alliance of Independent Social Democrats (SNSD), the Party of Democratic Action (SDA) and the Croatian Democratic Union (HDZ). " At the root of the stalemate, at least at the state and Federation level, is the division between the largest national parties - the ruling parties based in the Federation, the SDA and the HDZ, and the ruling party based in Republika Srpska, the SNSD, "Incko said, submitting the 56th report to the UN Secretary-General on the state of peace implementation in BiH.Incko said that the three parties' competing visions of BiH and their interpretation of the BiH Constitution were often against conditions that are part of the civilian aspect of the Dayton Peace Accords. He stated that the entity governments had adopted a number of reform measures of the European Union program, but added that no progress had been made in forming a new state government, following the general elections in October. The High Representative said that the parties disagreed on the basic aspects of the BiH Constitution, adding that some parties based in Republika Srpska were challenging the role and powers of the state in it, as well as previously agreed policies. "The European Commission delivered an opinion on the European integration of BiH in May, outlining 14 key priorities that BiH authorities must fulfill in the process of opening accession negotiations, which should have motivates political leaders to overcome differences and embark on key reforms, "Incko said. Instead, leaders of the SNSD, SDA and HDZ BiH concluded an agreement in August on principles for forming a government that expired in September, with no results. "which has led to more unrest and threats, especially of the SNSD, that it will withdraw from existing agreements." Incko indicated that the SNSD leader and a Serbian member of the BiH Presidency Milorad Dodik threatens to withdraw Republika Srpska from an agreement on the legal transfer of competences from the entities to the state, signed by the two entities before the establishment of the BiH Armed Forces, the Unified High Judicial and Prosecutorial Council (HJPC) and the Indirect Taxation Authority (ITA). " Dodik warned that all laws and decisions passed 'under pressure from the High Representative', even those approved in the Parliament of Bosnia and Herzegovina, would be annulled, "said Inko. The High Representative stated that the BiH Council of Ministers from the previous term was still functioning, but that his work is "limited by the politically calculated and unnecessary blockade of the BiH parliament." "This means that new laws, including a state-level budget, cannot be adopted, which greatly prevents the country from coping effectively with current problems such as the migrant crisis." He said that the destabilizing rhetoric of the divisions that dominated the political situation continued. " some RS leaders continue to make statements expressing separatist tendencies or predicting the breakup of BiH, while some Croatian representatives are seeking a territorial reorganization of the country. At the same time, the largest Bosniak party has again adopted a party platform that advocates for the Republic of BiH, which was not constructive, "said Incko. He said that" the widespread magnitude of convicted war criminals is still very widespread, which greatly hinders the possibility of achieving true and lasting reconciliation among all peoples. "He also pointed to the problem of lack of the rule of law in the country, adding that the rule of law and the functionality of judicial institutions will be his priorities in the coming period. Incko said that" it is especially shameful for the revisionism or even open denial of the Srebrenica genocide, which is legal. a fact confirmed by the judgments of international and domestic judicial authorities. "" In 1995, Srebrenica committed genocide. Nothing and no one can change that fact, "Incko said.
